item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "He that would live in peace and at ease, must not speak all he knows nor judge all he sees." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I leave my peace with you. I give my peace to you. I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be troubled. And do not be afraid. John 14:27" -- Anonymous

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Accept what life offers you and try to drink from every cup. All wines should be tasted; some should only be sipped, but with others, drink the whole bottle." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Tis a great confidence in a friend to tell him your faults; greater to tell him his." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If everyone is thinking alike, then no one is thinking." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by ben franklin
item.description: "The heart of a fool is in his mouth, but the mouth of a wise man is in his heart." -- ben franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "I agree to this Constitution with all its faults, if they are such: because I think a General Government necessary for us, and there is no <i>Form</i> of Government but what may be a Blessing to the People if well-administred; and I believe farther that this is likely to be well administred for a Course of Years and can only end in Despotism as other Forms have done before it, when the People shall become so corrupted as to need Despotic Government, being incapable of any other." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the assessment that something else is more important than fear." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Women are books, and men the readers be..." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "He that won't be counseled can't be helped." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The planet is fine. The people are fucked." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Here's all you have to know about men and women: women are crazy, men are stupid. And the main reason women are crazy is that men are stupid." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Meow” means “woof” in cat." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Think of how stupid the average person is, and realize half of them are stupider than that." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Laugh often, long and loud. Laugh until you gasp for breath." -- George Carlin

item.title: lamarcus add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Not only do I not know what's going on, I wouldn't know what to do about it if I did." -- George Carlin
